DOC.brief_title: Improving Pain Management Long Term Outcomes Following High Energy Orthopedic Trauma ( Pain Study )
DOC.detailed_description: In study , test whether adjunctive analgesic therapy pre peri-operative period , addition standard care pain management , improve overall pain control pain related outcome without increase analgesic related side effect . Patients randomize three treatment group . The intervention begin within 48 hour admission continue longer two week time definitive fixation . Group 1 : standard pain management , plus two week oral placebo , plus intravenous oral placebo 48 hour surgical procedure . Group 2 : standard pain management , plus two week oral non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug ( NSAIDs ) ( meloxicam ) , plus intravenous NSAIDs ( ketorolac ) oral placebo 48 hour surgical procedure . Group 3 : standard pain management , plus two week oral pregabalin , plus intravenous placebo oral pregabalin 48 hour surgical procedure . Specific Aim 1 : Evaluate effect standard pain management ( Group 1 ) vs. standard pain management plus pre peri-operative NSAIDs ( Group 2 - meloxicam + ketorolac ) treatment severe low limb fracture . Hypothesis 1a : When compare patient receive standard care pain management , patient treat NSAIDs : ( 1 ) reduce post operative opioid utilization ; ( 2 ) report reduce level persistent pain ; ( 3 ) noninferior rate surgery nonunion . Hypothesis 1b : When compare patient receive standard care pain management , patient treat NSAIDs benefit ( 1 ) improve post operative pain control ; ( 2 ) improve pre operative pain control ; ( 3 ) reduce lengths stay ; ( 4 ) reduce pain interference ; ( 5 ) improve functional outcome ; ( 6 ) low level depression post-traumatic stress disorder ( PTSD ) ; ( 7 ) improve overall health status ; ( 8 ) noninferior rate analgesic treatment related side effect . Specific Aim 2 : Evaluate effect standard pain management ( Group 1 ) vs. standard pain management plus pre peri-operative pregabalin ( Group 3 ) treatment severe low limb fracture . Hypothesis 2a : When compare patient receive standard care pain management , patient treat pregabalin : ( 1 ) reduce post operative opioid utilization ; ( 2 ) report reduce level persistent pain ; ( 3 ) noninferior rate surgery nonunion . Hypothesis 2b : When compare patient receive standard care pain management , patient treat pregabalin benefit ( 1 ) improve post operative pain control ; ( 2 ) improve pre operative pain control ; ( 3 ) reduce lengths stay ; ( 4 ) reduce pain interference ; ( 5 ) improve functional outcome ; ( 6 ) low level depression post-traumatic stress disorder ( PTSD ) ; ( 7 ) improve overall health status ; ( 8 ) noninferior rate analgesic treatment related side effect . Specific Aim 3 : Estimate incremental cost effectiveness adjunctive analgesic therapy relative standard care analgesic therapy treatment severe low limb fracture . Costs estimate health care provider perspective societal perspective . The time horizon cost-effectiveness analysis base actual period observation . Incremental cost-effectiveness ratio calculate : ( ) study group 2 ( NSAIDS - meloxicam + ketorolac ) relative standard care ; ( b ) study group 3 ( pregabalin ) relative standard care . For purpose cost-effectiveness analysis , effect measure unit change specific outcome metric 12 month ( long period available ) compare baseline .
